sanskrit_verse: पितृयज्ञं तु निर्वर्त्य विप्रश्चन्द्रक्षयेऽग्निमान् । चैन्दुक्षये पिण्डान्वाहार्यकं श्राद्धं कुर्यान् मासानुमासिकम् ॥ ३.१२२॥
transliteration: pitṛyajñaṃ tu nirvartya vipraś candrakṣaye'gnimān | caindu-kṣaye piṇḍānvāhāryakaṃ śrāddhaṃ kuryān māsānumāsikam || 3.122||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having performed the sacrifice to the ancestors, a twice-born man who maintains the sacred fire shall perform the monthly Śrāddha offering during the waning phase of the moon, specifically when the moon enters the asterism associated with the Pitṛs.

Causation is established through sequential participation in ancestral rites
Capacity-based responsibility requires maintenance of sacred fire and lunar observance
Restoration logic resides in regular repetition of offerings ensuring ancestral integration
Consciousness alignment occurs via precise timing and devotional execution of prescribed acts
